text: Life and Times of Michael K is a novel written by J. M. Coetzee in 1983. It won a Booker Prize. The story is about a simple gardener called Michael K, trying to run away from South Africa in the Apartheid Era. Some people think there is a link between Michael K and Josef K. in The Trial by Franz Kafka. Category:1983 books Category:Booker Prize winners Category:English-language novels Category:African literature
title: The Life and Times of Michael K
